text.content:
Phantasms follow a set of special rules.

  • Phantasms are entities of pure energy, capable of taking on various sizes and forms — even becoming exact replicas of you.

  • They do not talk or have a mind of their own. They aren't capable of reason or logic.

  • They only follow simple one-clause commands and cannot abstract meaning or extrapolate from them. For example, if you ask a Phantasm to grab some milk, it knows where the milk is because you do. It also knows that you are feeling thirsty — because you know it too. However, it won't understand that milk can quench thirst, nor will it know to pour the milk into a glass; these thought processes are too complex for Phantasms. So, it would just bring you the whole bottle of milk, with a deadpan look.

  • Phantasms share your base Attributes and defenses, have no MP, and their Phantasmal Vitality (PV) is equal to your base INS die size plus your level. They are immune to all status effects.

  • They have no Initiative score. Phantasms do not get a turn during conflicts, but on your turn, you can use an action to command one or more Phantasms, depending on the spell being used.

  • Phantasms always target Magical Defense.

  • If your Phantasms fall to 0 PV, they shatter. You can also shatter them through skills, spells, or at will. If you fall to 0 HP or leave a scene, your Phantasms shatter.

  • You may create a Phantasm and command it in the same action. After this first command—which directly follows its creation—on your next turn, it requires a whole action to be commanded again. Therefore, you cannot command Phantasm 1 and then proceed to create Phantasm 2 in the same action.

  • Unless stated otherwise, you can have up to 3 Phantasms active at the same time. Attempts to cast more Phantasms beyond 3 will fail.
